The definitions of specifiers are found on the indicated pages. **If psychotic features are present, code the “with psychotic features” specifier irrespective of episode severity. In recording the name of a diagnosis, terms should be listed in the fol- lowing order: major depressive disorder, single or recurrent episode, severity/psychotic/remission specifiers, followed by as many of the following specifiers without codes that apply to the current episode. Note: In children and adolescents, mood can be irritable and du- ration must be at least 1 year.
